## Arpeggio: Major 7b5 in G (Shape: C)

An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played one after the other rather than simultaneously. The Major 7b5 arpeggio in G (Shape: C) consists of the 1st, 3rd, 5th, and 7th notes of the G Major scale but with the 5th note flattened.

### Notes and Intervals:
- G (root)
- B (major 3rd)
- D# (raised 5th, diminished 5th in the key of G)
- F# (major 7th)

### Genre and Musical Flavor:
This arpeggio is often used in jazz and fusion music. It has a sophisticated and jazzy sound due to the major 7th interval and the augmented 5th (or flattened 5th, depending on how you perceive it) providing dissonance. It adds a touch of tension and color to musical passages.
